spirit:field.spirit:name: auto_reconnect
spirit:field.spirit:description: When this bit is set it will allow the link to automatically establish a new connection after it detects the remote port has disconnected. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Allows the TX logic to initialize and prepare for the movement of data between the local and remote port. After the port is initialized and capable of processing a corresponding ready bit will be set in the status0 register indicating so. 0 - Places the transmit data-path into a disable state. This state is used to 1 - Enables the transmit data-path for the local channel to initialize and prepare to move data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Allows the RX logic to initialize and prepare for the movement of data from the MCA to the application. After the port is initialized and capable of processing data a corresponding ready bit will be set in the status register indicating so. 0 - Forces RX logic into a disabled state 1 - Allows the RX logic to initialize and enter a state where data can be processed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lnk_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register bit enables the link to establish a virtual connection to its remote ends (i.e. enables the LTSSM). This does not rely on the RX or TX components of the channel to be enabled. Upon connection a corresponding status bit will be set indicating that the logic connection has been established. 0 - Forces the channel into the disabled state 1 = Enables the link to establish a connection to the far end.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the channel RX logic is ready to process data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the channel TX logic is ready to process data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lnk_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: This indicates that the LINK has entered U0 mode and the data-path is able to move data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ch_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that the link, RX, and TX components of the channel are in a state which will allow client data exchange.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: link
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: This register group contains channel based link management controls and status information.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ltssm
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register manages the LTSSM

spirit:field.spirit:name: pnd_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the U0 packet pending timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: u0rectimeout_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the activity timer when in U0. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: u0ltimeout_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Timer used to generate link up broadcasts 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: rec_act_rpt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the recovery active repeat timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_idl_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the master polling completion timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_idl_rpt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the polling idle repeat timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_act_rpt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the polling active repeat timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:register.spirit:name: test
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register manages the LTSSM

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_lcrd
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link to treat the next received lcrd command as if it were received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_lgood
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link to treat the next received lgood command as if it were received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_data_nrtry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link receiver to treat the next non retriable packet as if it was received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_data_rtry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link receiver to treat the next retriable packet as if it was received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_recovery
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the local LTSSM into a recovery action. This is intended for lab testing. This bit is cleared as soon as the LTSSM enters the recovery state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_tx_hdr_ovrd_time
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit controls where the system time stamp is inserted at. 1 - At the final stage before the output of the MCA.TX to the link. 0- At the arbitration input

spirit:field.spirit:name: measure_latency
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the round trip latency transactions protocol for this channel.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ltssm
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current State for LTSSM.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rec_idl
spirit:field.spirit:description: This port indicates that the ports are resynchronized and they are ready to enter back to U0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rec_act
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the port is in recovery and is waiting for the remote end to acknowledge the recovery action.

spirit:field.spirit:name: u0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that the port is now in operating state where application data can be transmitted between the two ports.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_idl
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit indicates that the LTSSM has found the far end port and is waiting for the far end port to acknowledge that it has discovered this port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_act
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit indicates the link is in the polling state. Polling is a discovery of the existence of a remote port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dis
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the LTSSM is in state disable. This is the default state from reset. As soon as software sets the link enable bit this state will transition to polling active.

spirit:field.spirit:name: inact
spirit:field.spirit:description: When in the inactive state software must clear the link enable bit and only enable it once the dis bit is set. This state is entered if the far end is disabled and re-enabled (i.e. entered polling) or if the recovery action timed out instead of completing the action.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: u0_to_rec
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register keeps track of the number of times the LTSSM state enters recovery from u0. This is not an error condition as much as it is a indication of general link health.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pol_fail
spirit:register.spirit:description: This registers counts the number of times polling failed to get a idle response after detecting a remote training packet (resulting in the return to polling)

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_frm
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the application side packets being transmitted through the channel

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_mcup
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the number of MCUP's transmitted due to transmitting the application data

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_frm
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the application side packets being transmitted through the channel

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_mcup
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the number of MCUP's transmitted due to transmitting the application data

spirit:register.spirit:name: latency
spirit:register.spirit:description: This reports the high water mark for the round trip latency measurement

spirit:field.spirit:name: mcup_pld_max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description: This indicates the maximum size an MCUP payload will be limited to. The MCUP size is calculated as follows: (bytes_per_clock_cycle*mcup_pld_max_size)+(bytes_per_clock_cycle-mcup_header_size) eg. for 8 bytes per clock cycle, and a header size of 4 bytes, and a default value of 8: (8*8)+(8-4) = 68

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_retry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit will force the channel to support the retry behavior on all its packets. This bit overrides the block_retry bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: block_retry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit will prevent all packets transmitted on this channel from supporting the retry behavior.

spirit:field.spirit:name: bw_src
spirit:field.spirit:description: Bandwidth measurements are derived before the fragmentation (i.e. raw bandwidth) or after the fragmentation logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: If a packet error is received during the notification point this bit will cause the FIFO to drop the packet.

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Used to enable or disable flow control from the TX FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hys_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: If this is set the hysteresis flag will be set or cleared based on the FIFO depth.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 - All packets will be dropped at the input of the FIFO 0 - Normal operation

spirit:register.spirit:name: rtry_buf
spirit:register.spirit:description: Retry buffer base address

spirit:field.spirit:name: base_addr
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register sets the base address for the channels retry buffer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hi
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the upper FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be set. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lo
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the lower FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be cleared. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth_limit
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This register defines the bandwidth range which the channel can consume. If the upper range is exceeded then the channel will enter a flow control state until the bandwidth usage drops below the lo threshold. To disable bandwidth controls set the high register to 0xffff, and the lower register to 0x0000.
Example: If bandwidth sample timer has a period of 256 core clock cycles the maximum number of bytes transmitted is 256 * 8bytes = 2048bytes (64 bit architecture in the core). If the hi register is set for 1536 this means a bandwidth which is greater than 1536/2048 =75% of the maximum bandwidth (10G with a clock of 6.4ns) will force the channel into a flow control condition. If the lower threshold is 1434 then the ratio is 1434/2048 which is approximately = 0.70 or 70% of the maximum bandwidth. When the bandwidth drops below this value then the flow control condition will be disabled.
*Note the bandwidth is the ratio of the number of bytes transmitted during a sample period divided by the maximum number of bytes which could be transmitted during the same period.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hi
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the upper limit on the bandwidth operating range. This is used to limit the channels bandwidth consumption. Values of bandwidth which exceed this value will cause the transmit flow control mechanism for this channel to be asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lo
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the lower limit on the bandwidth operating range. This is used to limit the channels bandwidth consumption. Values of bandwidth which drop below this value will cause the transmit flow control mechanism for this channel to be de-asserted.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmd_fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX Command FIFO - This FIFO contains link commands (derived from link protocol responses/actions)

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_pfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Packet FIFO level. This represents the data for all the packets held in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_nfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Notification FIFO level. This represents the number of packets in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_rd_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the number of times a packet has been dropped at the read side of the receive FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The write side of the FIFO has dropped the application packet

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the packet was written into the FIFO which was received with the error flag set during the notify condition.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: When flow control is disabled this indicates that the FIFO had reached its full point. If this happens during a packet it will be truncated and the error flag asserted with the EOP flag.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This Error indicates that MCUP data after and EOP is being transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that there was an EOP missing between two SOP's.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_max_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that the MCUP exceeded the maximum MCUP packet size (i.e. 64bytes).

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register reports the high level watermark of the channels bandwidth.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hys_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables a hysteresis flag to operate based on the write side FIFO count.

spirit:field.spirit:name: min_lvl_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When in this mode the FIFO will not indicate there is data in the FIFO until the minimum level of data or EOP is written into the FIFO. The FIFO will continue to transmit until the FIFO is emptied at which point it will not start transmitting again until the FIFO has been filled back up to the minimum level again.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: If a packet error is received during the notification point this bit will cause the FIFO to drop the packet at the read engine.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: Prevents all application packets from being written into the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1-packet mode. The data is not provided to the destination until the EOP is written into the FIFO 0-Streaming mode. The data is not provided to the destination until the ntfy_mode register value (in bytes) has been written into the FIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Depending on the mode of the FIFO two options can be set. Minimum level mode (number of FIFO words) Packet/Streaming mode (number of BYTES) The two modes cannot operate at the same time so this register is used for both controls.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lvl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the lower FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be cleared. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lvl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the upper FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be set. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_pfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Packet FIFO level. This represents the data for all the packets held in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_nfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Notification FIFO level. This represents the number of packets in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_rd_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the number of times a packet has been dropped at the read side of the receive FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The write side of the FIFO has dropped the application packet

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the packet was written into the FIFO which was received with the error flag set during the notify condition.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: When flow control is disabled this indicates that the FIFO had reached its full point. If this happens during a packet it will be truncated and the error flag asserted with the EOP flag.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_pkt_max_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates that the max size packet was written into the FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This Error indicates that MCUP data after and EOP is being transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that there was an EOP missing between two SOP's.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_max_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that the MCUP exceeded the maximum MCUP packet size (i.e. 64bytes).

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Enable register - Write 1 to enable, 0 to mask an interrupt

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which enabled interrupts source been occurred. Only generates an interrupt when the corresponding enable bit is set. Write 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which enabled interrupts have been triggered, Write 1 to clear

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register contains the active state of interrupt sources

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: tx
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Generator needed for self-test

spirit:register.spirit:name: iwg_cnt
spirit:register.spirit:description: inter word gap count

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-word gap count. This is the number of srdy "not ready" (srdy = 1'b0) cycles that can be inserted between words.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 2 cycles ect..

spirit:register.spirit:name: ifg_cnt
spirit:register.spirit:description: inter frame gap count

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-frame gap count. This is the number of clock cycles that can be inserted between packets.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 2 cycles ect..

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_cnt
spirit:register.spirit:description: number of packets to send

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator packet count select.
Set to "0" for continuous transmission mode.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_size
spirit:register.spirit:description: packet length size in number of bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description: Media generator packet length size in number of bytes

spirit:register.spirit:name: ctrl0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Media generator configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: random
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Randomization of the following register control setting (internally driven)
iwg_cnt ifg_cnt pkt_size
0 = disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: throttle
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator throttle enable. Allows CPU to control media generator transmitter source ready (srdy).
0 = srdy with/without drdy (may cause loss of traffic) 1 = srdy with drdy

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator "data" traffic mode select.
0 = incrementing data 1 = random data

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator enable. Must be set '0' if the corresponding media is trying to connect to the pipe. Can also be set '0' to stop a media generator that is set for continuous transmission mode. Actual transmission will not start until the go bit is hit (ie: first enable then hit go bit).
0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Go/Busy (Cleared by HW) write: 0 = disabled 1 = start of test read: 0 = test complete 1 = test is running

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the mgen_tx

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: wait_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit wait count of destination not ready (drdy)

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit packet count

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: rx
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Generator needed for self-test

spirit:register.spirit:name: mgen
spirit:register.spirit:description: Media generator configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: en_rxflw
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Receiver drdy ready (flow control)
0 = drdy receiver not ready 1 = drdy receiver ready

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator traffic mode select.
0 = incrementing data 1 = random data

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator enable. Must be set '0' if the corresponding media is trying to connect to the pipe. Can also be set '0' to stop a media generator that is set for continuous mode. Set '1' if setting go '1'.
0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: *Not implemented (expected possible future use)* Go/Busy (Cleared by HW)

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the mgen_rx

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: err_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Receive error count

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Receive packet count

variant.name: none
variant.doc: 'none' variant states including all templates which are not assigned any variant property.
